nodes.name: RandomForestClassifier
nodes.description: Supports both binary and multiclass labels, as well as both continuous and categorical features.
nodes.details:
Random forests are a popular family of classification and regression methods.
Random forests supports both binary and multiclass labels, as well as both continuous and categorical features.

Random forests are ensembles of decision trees. Random forests combine many decision trees in order to reduce the risk of overfitting. The spark.ml implementation supports random forests for binary and multiclass classification and for regression, using both continuous and categorical features.

More details are available at Apache Spark ML docs page:

spark.apache.org/docs/latest/ml-classification-regression.html#random-forest-classifier

fields.name: storageLevel
fields.title: Output Storage Level
fields.description: Storage Level of the Output Datasets of this Node

fields.title: Features Column
fields.description: Features column of type vectorUDT for model fitting

fields.title: Label Column
fields.description: The label column for model fitting

fields.name: predictionCol
fields.title: Prediction Column
fields.description: The prediction column created during model scoring.

fields.name: featureSubsetStrategy
fields.title: Feature Subset Strategy
fields.description: The number of features to consider for splits at each tree node.

fields.name: impurity
fields.title: Impurity
fields.description: The Criterion used for information gain calculation

fields.name: maxBins
fields.title: Max Bins
fields.description: The maximum number of bins used for discretizing continuous features.Must be >= 2 and >= number of categories in any categorical feature.

fields.name: maxDepth
fields.title: Max Depth
fields.description: The Maximum depth of a tree

fields.name: minInfoGain
fields.title: Min Information Gain
fields.description: The Minimum information gain for a split to be considered at a tree node

fields.name: minInstancesPerNode
fields.title: Min Instances Per Node
fields.description: The Minimum number of instances each child must have after split

fields.name: numTrees
fields.title: Num Trees
fields.description: The number of trees to train

fields.name: subsamplingRate
fields.title: Subsampling Rate
fields.description: The fraction of the training data used for learning each decision tree.

fields.name: seed
fields.title: Seed
fields.description: The random seed

fields.name: cacheNodeIds
fields.title: Cache Node Ids
fields.description: The caching nodes IDs. Can speed up training of deeper trees.

fields.name: checkpointInterval
fields.title: Checkpoint Interval
fields.description: The checkpoint interval. E.g. 10 means that the cache will get checkpointed every 10 iterations.Set checkpoint interval (>= 1) or disable checkpoint (-1)

fields.name: maxMemoryInMB
fields.title: Max memory
fields.description: Maximum memory in MB allocated to histogram aggregation.

fields.title: Min Information Gain Param Grid Search
fields.description: Min Information Gain Parameters for Grid Search

fields.name: maxBinsGrid
fields.title: Max Bins Param Grid Search
fields.description: Max Bins Parameters for Grid Search

fields.name: maxDepthGrid
fields.title: Max Depth Param Grid Search
fields.description: Max Depth Parameters for Grid Search

fields.name: numTreesGrid
fields.title: Number trees Param Grid Search
fields.description: Total number of trees Parameters for Grid Search

nodes.name: Split With Stratified Sampling
nodes.description: This node splits the incoming DataFrame into 2. It takes in the fraction to use in splitting the data by Stratified Sampling.
nodes.details:
Split With Stratified Sampling, which is the preferred way to sample from populations with varing subpopulation sizes.

Returns a stratified sample without replacement based on the fraction given on each stratum.

More details are available at : spark.apache.org/docs/latest/api/python/_modules/pyspark/sql/dataframe.html#DataFrame.sampleBy

fields.name: storageLevel
fields.title: Output Storage Level
fields.description: Storage Level of the Output Datasets of this Node

fields.name: keyInputCol
fields.title: Column Name
fields.description: column that defines strata

fields.name: fraction
fields.title: Fraction
fields.description: sampling fraction for each stratum. If a stratum is not specified, we treat its fraction as zero

fields.name: seed
fields.title: Seed
fields.description: random seed

fields.name: height
fields.title: Height
fields.description: Height of note

fields.name: comment
fields.value:
Churn Prediction:

Refer the Churn Data Analysis workflows for data exploration.


Total day minutes and Total day charge are highly correlated fields. Such correlated data won't be very beneficial for our model training runs, so we're going to remove them. We'll do so by dropping one column of each pair of correlated fields, along with the State and Area code columns, which we also won’t use.


Use stratified sampling for split.
fields.title: Comment
fields.description: Comments for the Workflow
